p: SARS-CoV strain GVU6109 was isolated from a lung tissue specimen of a SARS patient during the SARS outbreak in 2003[ 35]; its infectivity at 10 4 tissue culture infection doses (TCID 50)/mL vanished within 5 min after drying on paper or a cotton gown at RT[ 35], showing that the viral infectivity perished faster on the cotton gown than on an impervious surface ( e.g., the disposable gown) (5 min vs 60 min at 10 4 TCID 50/mL, 1 h vs 24 h at 10 5 TCID 50/mL )[ 35].
